intro: Porroglossum muscosum, commonly known as the sticky leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is notable for its hairy, glandular leaves that produce a sticky substance, which may serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. The sticky leaves and unique morphology make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
